The Rain Tiger at Will Technique is a contact-type perception ninjutsu, allowing one to freely manipulate rain infused with the user's own chakra. 

Contents

1 Overview
2
Orochimaru, in his true form, attacks the opponent with a multitude of white snakes from his own body and finishes the opponent with a slash from his Sword of Kusanagi that came out of his mouth.

The Rabbit Hair Needle is a Kekkei Mōra taijutsu used by Kaguya Ōtsutsuki.

Contents

1 Usage
2

Raging Thunder (魔導昇雷撃, Reijingu Sandā) is a sword technique utilised by Temujin by drawing energy from the Stone of Gelel.

Overview
By focusing gelel energy onto his sword and after dealing a blow with it, Temujin can create a powerful Gelel barrier before him. This technique was used in an attempt to negate Naruto's Rasengan. The two attacks resulted in a massive explosion that destroyed the mountain peak that Naruto and Temujin were fighting on.
Gaara performs Quicksand Waterfall Flow with Kankurō coating the sand wave with poison.
In his initial jinchūriki form, Naruto delivers a series of punches to the opponent and finishes with a kick.

Using his personal sand, Gaara grinds up rocks and minerals underground into a huge volume of sand that he brings above ground. The earth shakes as the sand surfaces, which Gaara then manipulates like a tsunami that he crashes against his targets. Targets are battered multiple times by the waves of sand as it spreads throughout the area. When the sand settles, the landscape is dramatically altered, taking on the appearance of a barren desert. Gaara can then use this sand to perform additional attacks, such as Sand Waterfall Imperial Funeral.[1]
Because of how much sand Gaara uses for this technique, the Fourth Kazekage assumes he can only use it in Tailed Beast Mode in order to gain access to the full power of Shukaku. He is subsequently surprised to see Gaara using it on his own.[2]

References

↑ 1.0 1.1 Tō no Sho, page 285

↑ Naruto chapter 546

Tsunade punches the ground, creating a shockwave that launches her opponent in mid-air. Then using her chakra enhanced strength, she punches the falling opponent in the gut with such force that it sends them flying up into the sky.
Sakura concentrates chakra into her foot and then stomps down on the opponent with tremendous force. A follow-up kick can be used directly after the stomp.

Using her Puppet Performance: Skilful Achievement with a Human Body, Chiyo launches Sakura high into the air to deliver a chakra-enhanced punch. It was powerful enough to destroy Sasori's ultimate defence, Hiruko.
Using his shield as a medium, Renga creates a massive chakra barrier. It is strong enough to withstand a bomb detonation.
Kankurō detaches the head of his puppet, Crow, just as the opponent is approaching. Its head then projects a spike from its mouth, stabbing the opponent.

Kankurō has Karasu sprout many poison covered blades on his arms and mouth and sends it spinning towards the opponent like a tornado, slashing them several times. After launching the opponent into the air, Karasu explodes near them. Karasu is unharmed by this explosion.

This is a technique used by Mukade while in his Ultimate Form. By taking advantage of his puppet body, Mukade extends additional blades and spikes on his centipede-segmented body. He then spins his own body at every joint, creating powerful gusts of wind and inflicting massive area damage to his vicinity.

The Mother and Father puppets join hands, extending a razor wire that Chiyo uses to initiate a flurry of deadly attacks. The wire is strong enough to slice cleanly through the Third Kazekage puppet's Thousand Hands technique.

Sasori uses the Third Kazekage puppet to release a spike of Iron Sand at the opponent that then drills them into some rocks. He then makes a huge cube of iron sand to fall on the opponent, crushing them.
Karasu's four arms open and shoot a barrage of kunai with explosive tags attached, which home in on the opponent and explode on impact.

Kankurō attacks his opponent using close-range taijutsu, then, as his face begins to crack, Kankurō is revealed to be Kuroari in disguise, and the real Kankurō is controlling the puppet from within the cloth on his back. Kankurō then uses Kuroari to capture the opponent.
Kankurō uses Karasu and Kuroari to shower the opponent with bombs.

Kankurō has Karasu deliver a few swift slashes to the opponent, after which Kuroari opens itself up, dropping a bunch of explosives onto the opponent. Kankurō proceeds to take cover within Sanshōuo as the grenades detonate.

Kankurō sends his puppet, Crow, rapidly dashing toward the opponent. Crow's six hands then project spikes and stab the opponent, sending them crashing to the ground. Crow then slams them with the spikes when they are on the ground.

jutsu_name: Puppet: Dance of the Cherry Blossom
jutsu_description: Chiyo uses chakra threads to control Sakura and dozens of kunai at the same time. Sakura runs at the opponent and Chiyo launches the kunai behind her, using Sakura to hide them from the opponent's view. At the last second, Sakura is pulled back by the threads, the opponent taking the shower of kunai. Then, Sakura jumps up high and comes down at the opponent preparing a chakra-enhanced punch, Chiyo adding extra momentum by pulling her down with the strings. Finally, Sakura punches the opponent creating a gigantic crater.

Kankurō has Karasu tackle the opponent, breaking its own body apart in the process. Kankurō then uses the puppet parts to deliver a series of swift strikes to the opponent, after which Karasu picks the target's body up and carries them through the air, with the finishing blow being a strong slam into the ground.

Toneri moulds his chakra into the form of a green-coloured sphere. The sphere can be used for various purposes such as controlling targets by entering their body, rendering a target unconscious, absorbing chakra from a distance, and detonating if needed.

While inside of his puppet Hiruko, Sasori fires the puppet's torpedo-shaped left arm towards the enemy. The arm rotates at high speed, launching the wooden cylinders attached to it. The cylinders then open, each one releasing a large amount of senbon, creating a quick rain of poisoned needles in all directions.

jutsu_name: Puppet Water Release: Dance of Mystic Rain
jutsu_description:
The puppeteer wraps the enemy with chakra strings in an effort to bind and restrict their movements, and then has the puppets spew water on the opponent. This technique was especially effective on Gaara as it prevented him from manipulating his sand which was soaked in water.

See Also
Water Stream Shooters

While under the control of Kaguya, Hamura kicks his opponent into the air then activates his Byakugan and leaps after them, unleashing a rapid barrage of punches and then a single powerful strike with his right hand, knocking them back to the ground.

See Also
Eighty Gods Vacuum Attack
After using Karasu and Kuroari to strike the opponent, Kankurō then proceeds to use his Sanshōuo puppet to launch a burning attack towards the opponent causing massive damage.

The Puppet Technique is the core skill of a puppeteer's (傀儡使い, kugutsutsukai) fighting style, whereby they control a puppet.

Contents

1 Overview
2 Known Styles
3

While inside his puppet Hiruko, Sasori summons two large torpedo-shaped containers. When opened, the two containers release thousands of kunai that pierce into the target's body. Then, another set of kunai are loaded into the wooden cylinders attached to the containers. When opened, a full load of kunai with multiple explosive tags attached to each are shot to the ground near the target. They then detonate, causing a large explosion.

As a last resort, Toneri summons countless Byakugan from the disintegrated Energy Vessel and infuses them into himself. The Byakugan seemingly grants him immense power, which he claimed to be capable of bringing about the end of the world. However, the true power of this technique is never shown as he was exposed to sunlight, affecting the chakra in the Byakugan and surpassing his chakra capacity limit, making the technique highly unstable and impossible to control. The sunlight also caused the technique to go berserk and mutate the user into an unstable white mass with a large mouth protruding from the back, which would lead to Toneri either melting or exploding.[1]

References

↑ The Last: Naruto the Movie novel

jutsu_name: Puppet Performance: Skilful Achievement with a Human Body
jutsu_description:
A puppet performance technique where chakra threads are attached to various spots on a person's body; the head, torso, both arms, and both legs. The person being manipulated gains the ability to not only use their own techniques, but the skills of the puppeteer as well.
The origins of this technique lie on the battlefield. When a puppeteer's puppets were all destroyed, they would begin using corpses. To perform this technique with a living person would normally require both parties to cooperate with each other. However, a highly skilled user can control the target by force if the person is severely weakened or damaged, rendering them unable to resist.
In Gaara Hiden: A Sandstorm Mirage, Kankurō was able to combine this technique with his knowledge of the chakra pathway system to develop the ability to use the chakra threads to disrupt his victim's flow of chakra, thus hindering their ability to use techniques and causing them extreme pain.[2]

While inside his puppet Hiruko, Sasori sends the puppet's iron tail towards the opponent, hitting them repeatedly and causing them to fall to the ground. Finally he stabs them in the torso with a powerful thrust of the tail.
Kankurō jumps and then makes his puppet Karasu shoot smoke bombs at an angle the poison smoke will spread and damage them nearby.
Kankurō uses Karasu to shoot multiple poison covered kunai from its body at his opponent.

Hiruko uses this technique to take control of people. It can be activated long after the technique is first applied. The appearance is a red eye with another circle in it resembling the pupil, with four lines stemming from the upper line of the eye and two big thick lines stemming from the side of the eye. This power seems to control the minds of others as it appeared on Kakashi Hatake's forehead, vanished, then took control over his body. The eyes of the person who get caught by this technique turn red while they are being controlled.
The technique works in a manner similar to controlling a puppet; using hand motions to guide the target to its destination.
After taking a sample of the target's hair with the use of a puppet, the user forms a specific hand seal, and takes control of the target.

jutsu_name: Puppet Performance: One in Body and Soul
jutsu_description:
Chiyo uses the Mother and Father puppets to attack the opponent with a flurry of attacks.

See Also
Puppet: Father and Mother
Jūgo grows many jet-like appendages to propel himself towards his opponent, and lands a series of punches and swipes.
This is a technique in which Shion's bell illuminates and negates any negative occurence. It was powerful enough to protect Shion from Mōryō's darkness.

jutsu_name: Protecting Eight Trigrams One Hundred Twenty-Eight Palms
jutsu_description: This is the upgraded version of the Protecting Eight Trigrams Sixty-Four Palms. This technique sends out an outward burst of the chakra dome created.

Maki uses her cloth for defensive means by wrapping it around her and any nearby allies, she can form a protective barrier. The cloth can be made around a nearby object such as a rock, to better hold down the fortification. If the cloth is made wet by a Water Release technique, it allows the dome to defend against powerful heat-based attacks.

See Also
Earth Release: Rock Shelter
Unsealing Technique: Segmented Iron Dome
Wood Release: Wood Locking Wall

Created by Hinata, this is a highly versatile technique which affords both offensive and defensive capabilities whereby she emits a constant stream of chakra from her palms, which are formed into extremely thin, sharp, blades. 
While using this technique offensively, Hinata shapes the chakra into thin, sharp, flexible blades allowing her to hit hundreds of targets with extreme precision and can cut smaller targets, like bees, into pieces. 
When used defensively, Hinata creates much larger, stronger, more flexible, arc-shaped chakra blades that spread out across her entire attack range, effectively forming a barricade between herself and her opponents, rebuffing even the largest and smallest of targets.
With the addition of Hinata's flexibility, the technique creates an "absolute defence" effect similar to that of the Eight Trigrams Palms Revolving Heaven, though the cutting nature of the chakra prevents any outside force from restricting it.

The user enters the target's subconscious by placing a hand on the target's head and extracts any information needed, even if the target has forgotten it or has had it blocked. A special device can be used to decrease the time it takes to read the target's mind and allows other ninja to assist. Memories that have mental blocks on them will require longer periods of time to probe through and obtain however. 
Depending on the skill of the user and their level of experience, they will be able to go through days worth of the target's memories in a matter of moments and sift through until they find what they want while others may have to go through each memory in its entirety.[2][3]

This technique enables the user to make a hologram of themselves in order to send a message.

See Also
Genjutsu Communication
Magic Lantern Body Technique
A delivers a series of palm-themed strikes to the opponent, with the last one sending the opponent into the air.

The user applies a red seal on the prisoner's neck, should they be granted limited movement outside prison. The user can instantly activate the seal to kill the prisoner should they disobey orders. Also, if they are a certain distance away from the user or the user is killed, the seal will automatically kill the branded. If close enough and facing it, the user can remove it with a Seal of Confrontation.

See Also
Cursed Tongue Eradication Seal
Fire Release: Heavenly Prison
Ice Release: Earthen Consecutive Chains of Ice

Using his chakra,[3] Gaara breaks open the earth and uses his sand to pull a target up to two hundred metres underground; targets are dragged down so quickly that they cannot escape it. Because of the depth that they're buried at, targets are rendered unable to move even a finger. Gaara then applies additional pressure to them with the sand, crushing them to death. Tō no Sho likens this technique to the larva pits of antlions.[1]

References

↑ 1.0 1.1 Tō no Sho, page 221

↑ Naruto Collectible Card Game

↑ Naruto chapter 217

Naruto, Konohamaru, and Iruka throw their fūma shuriken at the opponent. Then Naruto and Konohamaru perform their Sexy Technique, sending Iruka flying towards the opponent, knocking them out of the sky. Afterwards, Iruka hits both Naruto and Konohamaru in the head.

jutsu_type: Kekkei Genkai, Ninjutsu, Dōjutsu, Chakra Absorption Techniques
jutsu_description:
This article is about information on the ability. For information on the character, see Preta Path.




The Preta Path (餓鬼道, Gakidō) grants the user the ability to absorb chakra in any form. Pain channelled the Preta Path through the corpse of a Kusagakure shinobi.
This ability is primarily defensive in nature as it is capable of absorbing chakra from an individual through physical contact. In addition to this, the Preta Path is able to absorb ninjutsu-based techniques that are pure chakra or chakra based, thereby nullifying their effect. It doesn't absorb physical attacks, like Gaara's sand, but does drain the sand's chakra.[1] This is done by forming a barrier around the user's entire body, allowing them to absorb attacks from all directions.
Although the ability is able to absorb senjutsu chakra, the user is still vulnerable to the effects of turning into a stone statue from absorbing too much of it.
During the Fourth Shinobi World War, Nagato used the Preta Path to absorb Killer B's chakra while he was in his Version 2 form. He then apparently used the chakra to revitalise his body to its state before it was emaciated by the Demonic Statue of the Outer Path. It also restored his hair colour back from white to red, as well as the damage done to his legs. However, presumably due to loss of muscle memory, he was not able to use the legs completely.[2]

Influences
In Buddhism, the Preta realm (also known as the Hungry Ghost realm) is a reincarnation based on strong possessiveness and desire which were cultivated in a previous life or lives. The Preta are humanoid creatures which are perpetually hungry and thirsty, but are unable to satisfy themselves, living lives similar to those of hopeless addicts trying to appease their unyielding hunger. In appearance, the Preta are deathly pale, emaciated figures, which contrasts with Pain's Preta Path's hefty stature. In Hinduism Preta could also mean ghosts this also relates to the technique the Preta path uses. 

References

↑ Naruto chapter 560, page 14

↑ Naruto chapter 550, pages 17-18
Jūgo grows his hand to great proportions and swats at his opponent.

jutsu_type: Kekkei Genkai, Ninjutsu, Dōjutsu, Taijutsu, Kenjutsu, Chakra Flow
jutsu_description: Sasuke slashes his opponent with both an electrified sword and a black flame sword, before using Amaterasu.

jutsu_name: Pressure Points of Harm and Death
jutsu_description:
Guren releases two tenketsu points to greatly increase her chakra for a short time by changing her life force into chakra, allowing the use of taxing techniques such as Crystal Release: String of Glory. The amount of chakra released is so much that it becomes visible and causes water to form a vortex around her, similar to the one caused by opening the "Sixth Gate of Joy" from the Eight Gates. Her eyes also turn completely white momentarily.

See Also
Antlion Ninja Arts: Ephemeral
Eight Gates
Seven Heavens Breathing Method
Bando's Chakra Armour

Shizune wears a device on her forearm that's loaded with five senbon. While contained within the device, the senbon are immersed in a poison potent enough to leave victims near-death from a mere scratch. The device is fired by pulling an attached string, which quickly shoots the five senbon at any target Shizune aims at. Because of how the device is configured, the senbon cannot be fired individually. However, by channeling her chakra into the string, Shizune can alter the trajectory of the senbon, either to concentrate them on one point, spread them over a larger area, or even change the direction of the senbon from what the device is aimed at. Shizune generally uses this as a surprise attack, as the device is hidden by her sleeve, is not bulky enough to be noticed, and furthermore she does not give the impression of being able to fight, thus lowering an opponent's guard.[1]

Tsunade enters Sannin Mode and punches her enemy's abdomen (warning them to brace themselves) with such might that in slow motion it appears as though he or she will be snapped in two. They're pushed backwards at tremendous speed, however, razing through a field of trees until they're finally stopped by a large boulder, which causes Tsunade's opponent to take even more damage. Shortly afterwards, a volcano erupts in the background as a result of the punch's power, dyeing the battlefield crimson. Tsunade, straightening herself up, is left wondering whether she perhaps went too far.

Jiraiya uses his Wild Lion's Mane Technique to extend his hair, then swings it 360 degrees to slam the opponent and send them flying into the air. He then uses the Fire Release: Fire Dragon Flame Bullet on the opponent and then slams his Rasengan onto them, absorbing the fire chakra and forms into the Fire Release: Great Flame Rasengan with a white orb inside instead of black. The Rasengan is released from Jiraiya's hand, and instead of an explosion of fire, when the opponent hits the ground like the Great Flame Rasengan, a small cyclone composed of flame appears and after disappearing for a few seconds, rain made of fire falls to the ground at a dramatic speed.

jutsu_name: Prepared Puppet: Eight Waves of Needles
jutsu_description: Sasori, while inside of his puppet Hiruko, makes the puppet spit a rapid stream of countless senbon from its mouth, in a fashion similar to a machine gun. These senbon can be poisoned for increased lethality.

While standing in front of "sky that fell to earth", where polar particles are hidden, the user performs the required hand seals. A tower of light will burst from the ground of great intensity. Within the light, the polar particles are stored in a container with seal tags about it.

jutsu_name: Polarised Sand Formation: Hot Sand Camouflage
jutsu_description:
The user infuses chakra by placing both hands on the ground, making sand particles polarise which is able to bend light, they erupt in the direction of the users comrades, covering them and rendering them invisible and much harder to detect, save by a sensor. This technique appears to require ample time to perform for the build-up of chakra.

See Also
Dustless Bewildering Cover
Earth Release: Hiding in Rock Technique
Hiding with Camouflage Technique
Transparent Escape Technique

Fuen first uses poison that is thin and tiny enough to be taken in the air. Her target will inhale the poison and start to see the things that Fuen chooses, like caves, moths, or allies of the target trying to kill the target. When her target is imprisoned in her genjutsu, Fuen charges and kills her target.

References

↑ Naruto Collectible Card Game

The user jumps up and throws the some amount poisoned senbon into the opponent with a swing.

See Also
Senbon Shower
May Rain Blood River
User rushes at the enemy and attacks with poison-lubricated Metal Gauntlets, leaving a trail of poisonous claws.

jutsu_name: Poison Mist Hell: Hundred Continuous Firing
jutsu_description: Using his Puppet Technique, Kankurō spins Karasu and Kuroari around his target at high speed. Karasu launches poison gas bombs at the opponent, surrounding them with a gas cloud. Then both puppets fire a barrage of senbon from their arms at the now blinded victim.
The user jumps up into the air, lands a couple powerful physical attacks, grabs there opponent, and powerbombs them.

This technique combines ninjutsu, chemistry, and medical knowledge, thus requiring fine chakra control and advanced ability in medical ninjutsu. The user converts chakra in their body into a special chemical that they then exhale from their mouth. When the chemical comes into contact with the air, it becomes a cloud of poison. Breathing in even a small amount of the poison will cause immediate death.[1]
The Poison Mist used by Ibuse differs from that used by Shizune. Rather than kill those that inhale it, Ibuse's causes victims to become paralysed after only a few seconds, allowing Hanzō to attack them at his leisure with his kusarigama. Ibuse must first generate and store the poison within his body for five minutes before he can use it.[3]
Shizune first uses her Poison Mist on her opponent and then attacks with her chakra scalpels few times. Finally, she jumps in the air and throws senbon at her opponent.

Torune puts his hands together to form a small poisonous smokescreen sphere from his rinkaichū between his hands, Torune can then blow the smokescreen across the area in front of him, the poisonous smokescreen when spread gets bigger. If touched or inhaled, it is a guaranteed fatality.

Plasma Ball (荷電障壁殻, Purazuma Bōru) is a technique utilised by Ranke by drawing energy from the Stone of Gelel.

Overview
By converting the Gelel energy into electricity, Ranke can create a plasma barrier around her to serve as a defence which protects her from incoming attacks. The shield can be used offensively, by discharging the electricity in the direction of her choice in a wave.
While Ranke is in her transformed state, the Plasma Ball is strong enough to defend her from something as wide-ranged as the Quicksand Waterfall Flow, and she can rush at her opponents even if the barrier is active. However, if her electricity is drained, she cannot form the barrier and will be left vulnerable.
Hiruko slams the opponent with his tail and fires a poison missile at them. If the missile itself does not kill the opponent then the poison most likely will.
Jūgo punches the opponent and then rushes up to them to deliver a more powerful punch.

Naruto Uzumaki — while in Nine-Tails Chakra Mode — creates a Big Ball Rasengan in one of his hands, which is then surrounded by three regular-sized Rasengan, in a similar manner to moons around a planet. When coming into contact with a target, the disordered rotations of the individual Rasengan, created by the central and smaller ones spinning in different directions, interact with each other to form a massive and turbulent wave-like vortex.
The strength of this technique is so great that it even took a shinobi reincarnated by the Impure World Reincarnation technique a significant amount of time to regenerate, which they normally do instantly.[1]

References

↑ Naruto chapter 558, page 1
Sasori while inside Hiruko swirls around spraying a green poison cloud around himself affecting nearby opponents.
The user creates lightning with a pink hue from their hands which is powerful enough to shatter rock. It can also be channelled through other techniques, allowing for more versatility.
While using his Sage Transformation ability, Jūgo can alter his arm into a piston to increase his attack power. To increase it even more, Jūgo can form jets on his hands or elbows.

The user uses their transformation to grow jet booster-like arms that increases his attacking and throwing power. This is a more powerful version of Piston Fist, with the combination of the Jet Booster Jump.
Lee unlocks several chakra gates, and then charges into the opponent, lifting them upwards into the sky like a rocket. After reaching a certain distance, Lee crashes back into the ground.
Komachi throws multitudinous needles at the opponent, causing major damage.

Naruto rams his opponent, and creates two shadow clones that quickly prepare a Rasengan, after which the original Naruto kicks his opponent towards his clones' direction, creating a Rasengan of his own, and finishes the opponent by catching them in between he and his clone's Rasengan.

The user creates a giant flamed pheasant that they direct at a target. In Boruto: Naruto the Movie, the pheasant merely grapples with Naruto Uzumaki's Tailed Beast Mode until it is torn apart by Naruto. In the Boruto anime, it explodes on impact with its target, doing extensive damage to the surroundings.[1]
Transformed as Isobu, Yagura pounds the ground, causing water to spring up at his opponent, throwing them up in the air.
Mifune slashes at his opponent a few times, kicks them away, and them stabs them down with a reverse grip of his sword.

Ino skates towards her opponent with chakra on her feet and purple flowers surrounding her. She then knees them into the air, jumps after them, and twirls gracefully before delivering a powerful, chakra-enhanced kick.

Ino runs forward to the opponent and then she disappear in a curtain of purple petals. She appears behind the opponent and concentrate chakra into a rope of petals, then she kicks the opponent and throws a kunai attached to an explosive tag at them.

While in his level 2 cursed seal form, Sasuke kicks upward to launch the opponent into the air. He then glides after them and performs another flipping kick to slam the opponent into the ground, then finishes up with a Chidori.

Ino rushes forward to the opponent and disappears in a curtain of purple petals. She appears behind the opponent and concentrates her chakra into a rope of petals, then hits the opponent with a powerful punch.

Kurenai attacks her opponent first by lowering her stance and then spinning into the opponent to deal a knee strike, followed with a kick that pushes the opponent backwards, where she then grabs the opponent, lifting them into the air. She finally delivers a barrage of several kicks to their stomache, kicking them into the ground.

Karin sprays a massive amount of pink perfume that does low to medium damage while poisoning the opponent in the process. Besides poisoning the opponent, it can also lower her opponent's speed and defence. While in Awakening Mode, it also acts as a guard breaker.
The user grabs a falling opponent by their ankles, wraps his legs around their waist, and drives them head first into the ground, similar to the Front Lotus.

Sasuke kicks the opponent. He then dashes behind and punches the opponent from behind. He then jumps into the air and performs an axe kick. He then rushes behind the opponent again and sweeps off their feet, upward flip kicking the opponent as he does. He then jumps once more, this time behind the opponent, and punches them into the ground face-first. Finally, falls with a heel drop on his foe akin to the Lion Combo.
Sasuke headbutts his opponent, and jumps over them, kicking them in the head. He then kicks them up in the air, punches them back on the ground, and finishes with a Fire Release technique.

After forming neccessary hand seals and reciting an incantation, by using this technique, Mukade absorbs the seal placed by the Fourth Hokage, thus he is able to time travel. The people caught in the blast are also sent through time.
Specifically, Mukade travelled back by twenty years, six years before the seal was placed, though Naruto Uzumaki and Yamato arrived six years later.

This technique allows the user to share their past and experiences with a Byakugan user. The user will expel a glowing bubble from their mouth that releases blinding violet rays, which reacts to the person's Byakugan to project images into their mind. However, only those who are worthy are capable of seeing the vision while those from outside the determined targeted area are incapable of doing so. After the vision is transferred, the sphere can be retracted to the user.

This is a technique utilising the Takumi Village special Weaknessless Soaring Shortswords, to create a vortex to push away materials covering the user's body. Seimei used it to free himself of Gaara's sand.
Utilising the Takumi Village special Weaknessless Soaring Shortswords, the user swings one of the blades to create a powerful whirling gust of wind.

The user moves at a target at high speeds and delivers a body slam. Because of how quickly they move, the user travels in a fairly straight line, necessitating that they anticipate the target's movements in order to ensure a successful strike. As they move at the target, the user spins rapidly in order to pierce targets, drilling even through stone. Unlike the Fang Passing Fang, this technique is performed alone; users therefore require additional training to raise its attack power enough to compensate for this.[1]

References

↑ 1.0 1.1 Tō no Sho, page 250
Chōji uses the Super Multi-Size Technique only in one part of his body, similar to the Partial Multi-Size Technique.

The Parent and Child Rasengan is cooperation ninjutsu where two shinobi — a parent and a child as the name suggests — combine their Rasengan to create a massive one.

Contents

1 Usage

1.1 Naruto and Minato's Version
1.2 Naruto and Boruto's Version


2

This is a more practical application of the Multi-Size Technique. Rather than increase the size of their entire body, the user increases the size of only specific body parts, typically the arms and legs. Because of the larger size, physical attacks made with the expanded limbs do greater damage than normal. The limbs' growth is very fast, giving users a way of taking opponents by surprise. As with other techniques of the Akimichi clan, its chakra requirements are quite high,[1] to the point that, in Part I, Chōji takes one of the Three Coloured Pills before using this technique.[2]
Shino uses his kikaichū to form a tornado that traps the opponent. He then walks into the tornado and sends another cluster to crush the opponent.

Following an Aburame clan member placing a number of kidaichū onto the skin of an enemy, these insects immediately burrow into the victim's body and begin to devour its flesh and chakra. This process causes the insects to grow rapidly in size, until the host body is completely eaten away from the inside out.

References

↑ Fourth Databook, page 246
Shino uses his kikaichū to form a funnel that traps the opponent, spins them around violently, and then throws them away.
This technique is a larger and more powerful version of the Floating Bugs technique.
The user expands their leg and sends the opponent flying with a kick.

Shino manipulates his kikaichū to form a giant pillar that collapses into a wave that engulfs the opponent. The bugs then turn into a whirlpool that drag the opponent below ground before spouting out as a pillar that implodes.
Shino's kikaichū combine into two spear-like forms that spiral towards the enemy and carries them into the air, where they brutally feast upon their chakra.

Shino releases hundreds of thousands of kikaichū from his body into the air. On his command, the insects attack the opponent in five waves. They then coalesce into a large cloud and rain down on the opponent, and then the insects form a giant meteor-like insect sphere crashing down on the opponent.
Shino creates a cloud of kikaichū that lifts the opponent into the air. Then, many spheres of them repeatedly strike the opponent before sending them crashing to the ground.

Shino manipulates the kikaichū to form a large airborne cloud that descends on the opponent. After the insects are on the ground surrounding the opponent, the insects swarm upon them, and quickly erupt into an explosion of insects.

Shortly after a member of the Aburame clan is born, thousands of insects are allowed to colonise his or her body. In exchange for getting to feed off of their host's chakra, the insects follow the host's every command: from attack to defence to reconnaissance, and everything in between. The insects inevitably become the core ability of the Aburame's entire fighting style, upon which all of their other jutsu rely.
This technique, alternatively translated as "Kikaichū Technique", is named after the kikaichū, the species of insects that Aburame are most commonly colonised by. But they are not the only option: Torune uses rinkaichū and Yōji used kochū. Aburame are not even restricted to a single species: Shino uses both kikaichū and kidaichū; Muta uses kikaichū and shōkaichū.

The Parasite Clone technique is one utilised by Akatsuki's White Zetsu.

Usage
This technique allows White Zetsu to biologically produce clones of himself, of which is able to communicate and control remotely.[2] Being his perfect duplicates, they resemble him closely, aside from pants, sandals, and his flytrap like appendage. Unlike normal clones, they don't dispel when they are dealt damage or killed.[3] Even if the original user is killed, they will not dispel.[4] They can also be used with White Zetsu's Substitute Technique to assume the form of any individual that he has touched, even copying their unique chakra and items.[5]

References

↑ Naruto chapter 540, page 9

↑ Naruto chapter 505, page 11

↑ Naruto chapter 487, pages 15-16

↑ Naruto chapter 618, page 12

↑ Naruto chapter 487, page 14

Kiba uses his Passing Fang to send the opponent flying, then Shino uses his Insect Pillar to send the opponent flying and Akamaru uses the Beast Human Clone to become Kiba and finish with the Fang Passing Fang.

Ukon can only perform this technique after activating his cursed seal's second level. Using his chakra, he disassembles his body on a cellular and proteinic level so that he can enter a target's body.[1] He then starts reforming himself, taking over certain parts of their body and gradually corroding the parts he hasn't entered yet.[3] Ultimately, the target dies, achieving this technique's primary purpose: assassination.[1] Ukon had previously been very successful in this regard, as the only way that victims could stop him would be by attacking their own bodies, something that none were willing to do. Kiba Inuzuka, however, experiences no such unwillingness; he badly injures himself, doing the same damage to Ukon, and in trying to kill himself drives Ukon from his body so that Ukon will not suffer the same fate.[4]

References

↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 Tō no Sho, page 209

↑ Naruto Collectible Card Game

↑ Naruto chapter 204

↑ Naruto chapter 205
Shino manipulates his kikaichū to swarm around the opponent and absorb their chakra and then providing the stolen chakra to Shino, allowing him to replenish his own.

The user spits out parasites at a target, which will burrow inside them. This allows the user to kill the target, inflict great pain, or take control over their movements. It is possible to resist it, though quite painful, and is preferable to remove the parasite before it burrows completely.

See Also
Body Coating
Body Controlling Technique
Body Oxidation Technique
Poison Cloud Technique
The user hits the ground with his fist and releases a large amount of chakra, creating a pulsating field that paralyzes anyone who hits it.

Shino reveals several kikaichū behind his opponent, which begin to wrap around them. At the same time, Shino sends more insects in a spiralling pattern. All the insects swarm at the opponent, damaging them, and then dispersing.

An illusion that relies on the sound of the flute. After the user plays a melody though the flute, whoever hears it will become paralysed as if their bodies became heavier.

See Also
Demonic Flute: Phantom Sound Chains

Konan disguises six hundred billion explosive tags as the surrounding scenery, be it earth or water, with enough sophistication that even the Sharingan cannot see through it.[1] When the target is in position, Konan causes the scenery to split in half, resulting in the rapid creation of a huge abyss beneath the target. Due to the sudden lack of any available foothold, the target inevitably descends ever deeper into the depths of the chasm. As the target falls, Konan guides the explosive tags to stick to their body and detonate, with six hundred billion being enough for ten minutes of consecutive explosions — more than enough to counter the five minute time limit on Obito Uchiha's intangibility.[2]

A technique that consists of using chakra to harden and shape paper into shuriken. The user can increase the power of the shuriken by further altering its final shape.[1] Konan could fold the paper shuriken into different shapes, including the normal four-pointed star shape[2] and a more kunai-like shape.[3] By combining it with Nagato's Wind Release: Gale Palm, the duo were able to increase their lethality.

After creating wings out of her paper, Konan uses them to launch a multitude of paper in rapid succession at the target. In the anime, this attack was strong enough to overpower Jiraiya's Fire Release: Flame Bullet technique.[3]

A technique which employs the use of Konan's ability to manipulate the shape and colour of her paper by forming it into one or more replicas of herself. When a clone is hit, it will merely turn back into sheets of paper. If need be, Konan can conceal explosive tags within her paper clones to allow for a deadly surprise attack.

Konan gathers a large quantity of paper sheets into a single chakram-like shape, which she then throws at the intended target. While in flight, the disc spins with tremendous speed, with its trajectory and inclination being freely manipulated by her. This presents opportunities to attack an enemy from all angles, even if the disc is initially avoided. The discs spins so fast that a collision between the two result in a considerable impact.

Naruto punches his opponent into the air, creates two to four shadow clones that jump in the air as well, before jumping himself. The clones hold his opponent down as they fall, with Naruto landing on them knee-first.

Shizune attacks her opponent a few times, then she spins around with her arm outstretched to hit them with a chakra scalpel. She finishes by hitting her opponent high into the air with another chakra scalpel.

This attack consists of a quick, precise thrust of the user's palm to the opponent's body. The attack sends chakra into the area of the foe where struck to either stun them, or if a more sufficient amount of chakra is used, cause severe internal damage.

Kimimaro uses his bone sword to strike the opponent with amazing speed at different vital areas of their body. This attack can be used repeatedly in succession to not give the opponent a chance to attack back.

By using the Chakra Liquid that bound their hands together, Naruto and Sasuke stretch the sticky substance, and launch a golden statue at the target like a slingshot with enough force to knock them out.
Obito jumps up in the air, attacks his opponent with three kunai slashes and kicks them down.

jutsu_type: Kekkei Genkai, Ninjutsu, Dōjutsu, Space–Time Ninjutsu, Barrier Ninjutsu, Taijutsu, Cooperation Ninjutsu
jutsu_description: Kakashi and Obito use Kamui to transport the opponent inside their pocket dimension, where they strike their target with a series of cooperative taijutsu attacks. After gaining enough distance, Obito creates a Black Receiver, through which Kakashi channels his Lightning Cutter. Obito launches the receiver, electrocuting and piercing them, both with the thrown receiver and the new ones which branch from it upon impact.
Kankurō summons Kuroari to sneak up behind the opponent, pinning their arms. Kankurō then uses a mouth-bomb wielding Karasu that rushes toward the opponent, causing the bomb to explode.
Jūgo hits the enemy at extreme speeds while part of his body is transformed.

Naruto delivers a string of punches and kicks using shadow clones. The penultimate of these attacks are enhanced with natural energy, which stuns his opponent. Naruto then jumps at his opponent and kicks them down, bouncing off them, going up high, and comes crushing down with a Rasengan.

Using his Kote, Boruto sends a Wind Release-infused shuriken at his opponent, pushing them back. Boruto then uses a Kote Water Release technique to flood the place, holding the opponent in place, and while surfing on the waves, sends a Vanishing Rasengan through the water, pushing the opponent up when it hits.

jutsu_name: Outer Path — Samsara of Heavenly Life Technique
jutsu_type: Kekkei Genkai, Ninjutsu, Reincarnation Ninjutsu, Dōjutsu, Kinjutsu
jutsu_description:
The Outer Path — Samsara of Heavenly Life Technique is a reincarnation ninjutsu used through the Outer Path, which can infuse new life into the bodies of the dead in exchange for the user's own life.

Usage
When this technique is activated, the King of Hell emerges from the ground and releases the souls of the deceased from its mouth. These souls may be recalled from even the crossroad between life and the afterlife, and are then returned to their rejuvenated bodies. The exact limitations of this technique are unknown, but on one occasion, it was able to resurrect a large number of individuals who had recently died. While using this technique, the caster is severely weakened; for instance, Nagato's hair turned white as a result of overexerting his power.[2][3] Ultimately, once the technique is finished, the user invariably dies.[4]
This technique can also be used to transform the corpse vessel of an individual revived by Summoning: Impure World Reincarnation into a real body of living flesh and blood.[5] However, whereas the rest of the reincarnated Madara Uchiha's body was made real, his eyes instead crumbled into dust upon his resurrection.[6]

The Outer Path (外道, Gedō) is one of the seven abilities of the Six Paths Technique granted to the wielder of the Rinnegan. It grants the user the power to control life and death. With this power, the user is able to revive the dead, transmit their chakra into black receivers, and manifest chakra chains.

Overview
One who wields the Rinnegan is said to exist outside the realm of life and death. They are regarded as the seventh Pain, the Outer Path, and wield the power to control life and death itself. With this power, the user is able to revive the dead through the Samsara of Heavenly Life Technique,[1] though doing so comes at the cost of the user's life.[2]
The Rinnegan allows for the creation of black receivers,[3] and by transmitting their chakra into these receivers, the user can bind anyone they touch through the power of the Outer Path. The user can also manifest the chakra chains of the Demonic Statue of the Outer Path to restrain those who touch the receivers with an even greater binding power.[4] By implanting black receivers into corpses or reincarnated individuals, the user can reanimate and remotely control the bodies as the Six Paths of Pain. These bodies, as well as the King of Hell and the creatures summoned through the Animal Path, all have reflections of the Rinnegan in their eyes and share visual information with the user through the Outer Path.[5][6]

     Souls summoned back from the Pure Land.  
During the Fourth Shinobi World War, Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki demonstrated the ability to recall the souls of the previous Kage from the Pure Land to assist him in summoning Team 7 and the tailed beasts back from Kaguya Ōtsutsuki's core dimension.[7] When summoned in this manner, the deceased person does not have an actual body, but appears as a mass of flickering chakra in full possession of their personality and memories. Once the user ends the technique, the summoned souls dwindle and ultimately disappear completely. Hagoromo was also able to undo another person's use of the Impure World Reincarnation technique, releasing the reincarnated souls from their vessels and sending them to the Pure Land.[8]
Sakura summons a giant Inner Sakura to deliver a series of punches.
Condor gives a powerful aerial kick to the opponent.

Condor gives a rising kick to the opponent's stomach.

Using his signature genjutsu, Gengo suppresses the will of his followers and forces them to attack with his opponent with taijutsu.

Konan morphs her right hand into paper and hits her opponent before spinning and doing the same with her left hand. She then sends two flurries of paper butterflies, separated by a spin, hovers toward her opponent covered in swirling paper that hits her opponent, and with a last attack, knocks her opponent far back.
Condor jumps high in the air to slam his opponent down with both his feet. A powerful shock wave is released from the impact point.

Prior to being struck by an attack, Urashiki activates his tomoe-less Rinnegan and causes it to glow blue. His body then disappears without warning, leaving behind ten glowing red orizuru, which slowly float to the ground before fading away. Afterwards, Urashiki's chakra signature is completely untraceable, allowing him to escape elsewhere unnoticed. The exact nature of this technique is unclear, but upon observing it, Sasuke Uchiha believed that it does not involve slipping into another dimension.

This is a technique that creates a numerous amount of small balls of light to attack the target. Just a single hit from one can result in the target feeling a burning sensation.

jutsu_name: Opening and Closing of the Universe
jutsu_type: Kekkei Genkai, Ninjutsu, Dōjutsu, Space–Time Ninjutsu
jutsu_description: Obito sends the opponent into his pocket dimension and uses the block formations to crush them.

The user tightly clasps their hands together and extends their middle and index fingers, resembling the Tiger hand seal.[2] Using the full weight of their body, the user thrusts these four fingers between the target's buttocks. Despite the technique's dramatic name, it is not actually harmful. The pain is fairly extreme, however, so much so that, when Kakashi Hatake uses it on Naruto Uzumaki, Naruto comically leaps into the air,[1] travelling a fair distance. Sakura Haruno blushes to see it used and Sasuke Uchiha declares both Kakashi and Naruto "buffoons".[2] The anime shows those who are familiar with One Thousand Years of Death are very unwilling to be subjected to it.[3] It has no effect on unconscious targets.[4]
Naruto later uses this technique against Gaara. Instead of his fingers, Naruto uses a kunai with an exploding tag attached. Unlike previous responses to the technique, Pakkun calls Naruto's attack "brilliant".[5]

A unique Hiden jutsu that is passed down to members of the Onikuma clan. Described as a "possession-type" Summoning Technique, the technique mutates the users arms into a beast-like form granting them enhanced strength and allowing them to stretch similarly to the Soft Physique Modification. Similar to Jūgo's Clan's Kekkei Genkai, this technique can prove mentally unstable at times as it can cause the user to assume a more bestial form when they become emotionally vulnerable resulting in them losing complete control over the technique. Enko Onikuma was prone to fits of rage which were triggered by feelings of loneliness caused by other's fear of her due to the jutsu's appearance. Until she understood what brought these fits, it required her team-mates to tranquillise her when she lost control.

This article is about the shinjutsu. For the chapter, see Omnipotence (chapter).



Omnipotence is a shinjutsu claimed to be used only by a god whose effect it to bring out the user's desire. Described as a programming language that Gods have used to create worlds and to make anything real. Because of this ability, Momoshiki Ōtsutsuki declared this technique as the most powerful shinjutsu of every existing ones.
Akin to genjutsu, this power is capable of affecting the mind of others, but unlike other genjutsu, this jutsu can be used on a far greater scale. Similar to the Infinite Tsukuyomi, this jutsu can be used on a worldwide scale, manipulating the memories of everyone on the planet to how the user sees fit.[1]

Usage
Modified by Amado Sanzu with Shibai Ōtsutsuki's genes, Ada inherited this power. However, because she is not an actual Ōtsutsuki, she has no conscious control of this technique, only able to instinctively use it to grant her deepest desires. Her first known use of this shinjutsu was charming everyone, both male and female, around her with her desire to find true love.[2] The symptoms of the charm affect everyone differently: headaches, vertigo, fever, impaired judgment, and stiffened muscles from extreme tension are the known symptoms.[3] The only exceptions to the charm are family members and the Ōtsutsuki clan.
Later, desiring to please Kawaki, she rewrote the memories of everyone on a global scale to perceive Kawaki as the son of the Seventh Hokage and Boruto as the outsider taken in by the Hokage after having channeled Kawaki's desire for switching lives with Boruto.
Guy pins the opponent down and does a hundred push ups on top of them in five seconds. After this, he spins around so fast that his legs catch fire and then he kicks the opponent into the air.

Ino lies about having feelings for her opponent after throwing a bouquet of flowers with a hidden exploding tag attached at them. While Ino runs away from the explosion, the confused opponent is caught in the blast.

By using a small portion of Gyūki's chakra and sacrificing one of its tentacles, Killer B can create a flawless clone of himself that neither the Sharingan, nor the Akatsuki, could distinguish. This clone is apparently long-lasting and can sustain considerable damage, only reverting back into the tentacle when completely drained of chakra.

Darui repeatedly slashes his opponent with his cleaver sword, finishing it with a powerful spinning attack that knocks them far back.

The user first smells the scent of their allies and produces sweat with movements. After sucking up sweat, it is then mixed with saliva to create a bubble from their mouth that lets them conceal natural body odour of their allies and themselves. 
A variation of this technique is done to fool enemies by producing many small bubbles of user's own smell by following same method and scattering it over a wide area. Except in this technique the user doesn't take scents of their allies and the bubbles do not conceal the smell.
A singular version of its parent technique, Lee instead starts spinning by himself creating strong winds around him, and dives down on the opponent rather than with them.

B manifests two of Gyūki's tails to hold down his opponent, pulls himself towards his opponent, and lands a punch, his hand also transformed into Gyūki's. As he's about to land the hit, B releases his opponent, allowing to hit to knock them back.

This Mangekyō Sharingan technique allows the user to telekinetically control objects after marking them with a seal on their hand. Using this technique, Shin Uchiha was able to freely manipulate his medical equipment to perform surgery, create makeshift prosthetic limbs and weaponry out of multiple scalpels, as well as manipulate his clone's body to shield himself.

Using nasal fluid, the user creates a water source. They can manipulate the liquid at will to expand into multiple tendrils, able to ensnare or pierce a target. The water can also solidify to maintain its shape and integrity to act as a support structure.
Using the hair he sheds, Pakkun creates dozens of clones of himself. These clones are able to float in the air, in a similar manner that hair is able to stay airborne.

This is a technique used by Koharu to extract a concealed explosive tag from its hiding place that could be a wall or a stud. The user must first detect the hidden object, as the technique forcibly pulls the object into their hand. The affected object will also phase through other objects in its way.
Using nunchakus, Might Guy lands a series of blows on the opponent and finishes with his Dynamic Entry, kicking them far away.

jutsu_description:
Using their strong front limbs, the ninken dig into the ground. This creates a cloud of dust which they can use to conceal their movements. It can also be used to create large holes in a short period of time.

jutsu_description: Naruto and Sai unleash a series of alternating physical attacks at their opponent. Naruto performs a drop kick, and Sai finishes it off with three ink lions.

jutsu_name: Ninja Tools Barrier: Reverse Fish Scales Formation
jutsu_description: This is a technique used by the Four Celestial Symbols Men. Devised to counter Gaara's sand, the formation draws upon their weapons (Weaknessless Soaring Shortswords, Garian Sword and Hōki's unnamed fire-shooting sword), arranged in a triangle with Gaara at the centre. The three members will use three underground waterways to connect their formation, which will converge under their target. With their weapons charged with their chakra, they will then activate the technique, sending a surge of power through the waterways to the central target. This will cause a water dragon to rise from the ground and envelop Gaara, soaking his sand and making it become much heavier. This causes it to clump and makes it near impossible to utilise.

jutsu_name: Ninja Art: Ten Thousand Flowers Profusion
jutsu_description: After kicking the opponent in the face and throwing a wolfbane, Ino then twirls elegantly around in the air and throws a barrage of poisonous purple flowers at the opponent.The flowers explode upon impact, releasing a shower of poisonous mist and purple petals.

Ino casts an illusion that tricks the enemy, causing them to see a storm of flowers. This technique has different variations ranging from a field of flowing petals to an overflow of petals surrounding the enemy. Once she has a clear shot, she throws the poisonous wolfsbane flower at the enemy hitting them in the head.

The user produces a fog by forcibly extracting all water within the grass, trees, earth and all other living beings throughout the entire area, trapping all within the area in a powerful illusion of themselves. In addition, because of the nature of this technique, it will quickly dehydrate its victims, eventually killing them. The technique can also be condensed to target a single person. If the user is rendered unconscious, the technique will end.

jutsu_name: Ninja Art: Dance of the Snowy Cherry Blossom
jutsu_description: Sakura binds her opponent in a genjutsu and proceeds to throw four small white bags at them filled with exploding tags, which are disguised as tiny, blank pieces of paper in the opponent's eyes. She rips them open in midair by throwing kunai at them and the exploding tags begin to fall gently towards the target. Lastly, Sakura aims a kunai with a final exploding tag attached to it at her opponent's feet and it detonates, followed by the explosion of the other falling "tags". There is a huge blast and the opponent is either killed or severely damaged.

jutsu_name: Ninja Art: New Moon Flower Wheel
jutsu_description: Ino twirls a bundle of moon flowers into the air which transforms into a circular blade, somewhat resembling a chakram. She then throws the blade at the opponent, slashing anything in its way. Once it gets to the opponent, it slashes through them and explodes into moon flower petals.
Ino jumps into the air and manipulates countless flower petals to surround, confuse and blind her opponent. She then proceeds to stomp them into the ground with a powerful kick.

jutsu_name: Ninja Art: Shuriken Giant Body Technique
jutsu_description: The user throws a fūma shuriken towards the opponent and uses their chakra to massively enlarge it, brutally striking the opponent and sending them flying.
After waving his hand seals, Rō creates a projection in mist-like fashion.
Rokkaku Ryūdōin summons a dragon made from chakra to attack the enemy, inflicting major damage to the opponent. This attack may also lower the targets defence.

jutsu_name: Ninja Art Creation Rebirth — Strength of a Hundred Technique
jutsu_type: Kinjutsu, Ninjutsu, Medical Ninjutsu, Regeneration Techniques
jutsu_description:
The Ninja Art Creation Rebirth — Strength of a Hundred Technique is a forbidden technique that is only accessible to those who have mastered the Creation Rebirth technique. 

Usage
While very similar in nature to its parent technique, which also regenerates the user's wounds via accelerated cell division, the Strength of a Hundred Technique has a continuous, automatic effect that will heal any damage that the user sustains instantly without the need to make hand seals or even a conscious effort to activate the healing process as long as they have chakra left. The enhanced regeneration granted by this technique is so rapid that even the wounds that resulted from Tsunade being impaled by two gigantic swords were completely healed mere moments after their removal.[3]
Use of the technique also requires the release of the Strength of a Hundred Seal, but rather than just covering the face, the markings extend over the user's entire body. As a testament to both its power and her confidence in its healing prowess, Tsunade has decreed that only medical-nin who have mastered this technique are permitted to break the first three rules that govern their role on the battlefield — which effectively prohibit their direct involvement in any conflict — that she herself established. This makes herself and her student, Sakura, the only ones allowed to break these rules.[4]
This technique's power can be temporarily transferred to another person upon physical contact, as seen when Sakura extended the technique's markings onto Obito Uchiha.[5]

When in his one-tailed form, Naruto slashes the opponent with his claws downward, then upward, then upward again to launch the opponent into the air. He then jumps into the air to slash the opponent away from himself. Using his chakra, he forms a hand to grab his opponent, then pulls them back and finishes with a bone-shattering punch.

This taijutsu allows its user avoid being slashed with blade weapons. The user has to stop the weapon literally with his bare hands, clamping the blade between palms.

References

The Nine-Tails creates orbs of black-red chakra that swirl around its body and damage anyone who touches them. The orbs then spread out while continuing to swirl even faster until they disappear. This has only been shown used by a false Nine-Tails.
With a swipe of its claws, Kurama can create a miniature tornado.

In his four-tails form, Naruto swipes downwards at his opponent with his right claws, makes a half spin, this time hitting with his claws, followed by a second chakra body emerging from his to strike with his right claw. Naruto continues with a backwards spin that again hits the opponent with the tails, throwing them up in the air, and then jumps spinning forward, hitting with the tails many times before finishing with a downward swipe with both arms.

Mecha-Naruto transforms part of its body into a cannon and fires a powerful laser, made from the chakra of Kurama, at its opponent.

In his four-tailed Version 2 cloak, Naruto swipes at his opponent while in the air, "drills" them with his tails, and briefly manifests a second upper body that throws his opponent back down.

In his one-tailed form, Naruto brushes his claws past each other, releasing a powerful horizontal crescent wave that rips though the opponent and causes them to crumple to the ground in pain.
In Naruto Shippūden: Gekitō Ninja Taisen! EX 3, this attack could only be performed with a Senzai Ninriki (Latent Ninja Power) active; this is no longer the case in Clash of Ninja Revolution 3 and Gekitō Ninja Taisen! Special.

While under the influence of dark chakra, Setsuna and Shizuku combine their elemental ninjutsu ability to create a thunderstorm that could disperse bolts of lightning in order to demolish areas. Doing so quickly drained both dark chakra and regular chakra reserves.

The Mysterious Peacock Method is a trademark technique of Hoshigakure and utilises chakra-enhancing radiation produced by a meteorite that fell 200 years prior to the start of the series.

The Mutually Multiplying Explosive Tags is a technique which forms part of a fighting style purposely designed for those who have been reincarnated, and employs the use of special explosive tags to create a near infinite series of explosions. By using their own body as a medium for the paper, the reincarnated individual creates several exploding tags formed from large sheets that each bear five seals on them. These special tags then attach themselves to the intended target, but just as they detonate, additional tags are created as these previous ones explode. This process is continuously repeated, leading to a near infinite chain reaction of consecutive explosions. By sacrificing themselves, this technique can also be employed by a live individual.[1]

This technique uses a metal string strengthened with chakra to make a thread capable of constricting a target and cutting through steel with little difficulty. The user can also use the wire to form complex string figure design with his hands, and launch the figure from the string as a powerful cutting attack.

This technique is used by Shion. She releases power through her bell, and completely transforms. This allows her to send a huge ray of light which can penetrate Mōryō's darkness. In this form, she has the ability to, and attempted to, completely destroy Mōryō along with herself. She was pulled out by Naruto before she could do so.

This technique is essentially a large-scale version of the Wood Clone Technique where the user uses pre-existing vegetation in their immediate vicinity as a medium to create a large number of wood clones.

jutsu_type: Ninjutsu, Barrier Ninjutsu, Fūinjutsu, Cooperation Ninjutsu
jutsu_description:
By having more than one person using the String Light Formation, the effects of the jutsu are amplified, making it so even weaker users can successfully entrap a stronger opponent if they have enough users.
Seventeen prospective Genin were able to use this technique to make it difficult for even Kakashi Hatake to move.

Naruto punches the enemy and jumps from their shoulders into the air where performs Multiple Shadow Clone Technique to create countless clones that throws each other at the enemy. Naruto proceeds with entering his one-tailed form.
After creating a smoke clone, should it be sufficiently struck, it will disperse into smoke and then form into multiple smoke clones.

This technique is a larger-scale version of the standard Shadow Clone Technique; there is no real difference between them beyond the number of shadow clones being created. Creating even a single shadow clone will require half of a user's chakra, for which reason the normal Shadow Clone Technique is generally only safe to use for jōnin.[2] Because of how many clones are created with the Multiple Shadow Clone Technique, the chakra cost is far greater, rendering it unsafe to use for most people other than the Hokage. For this reason, the First Hokage declared it forbidden and hid it away in the Scroll of Seals. Naruto Uzumaki is among the few exceptions to this rule because of the sheer amount of chakra he has access to.[1]
There is no established number of created clones separating the regular Shadow Clone Technique from the Multiple Shadow Clone Technique. Average users tend to make no more than five shadow clones at a time with the regular version, whereas Naruto will make dozens, hundreds, or sometimes even a thousand with the Multiple version. Naruto Shinden: Parent and Child Day takes it in the opposite direction, showing Naruto use the Multiple Shadow Clone Technique yet only managing to make two clones because of how tired he is. Naruto sometimes doesn't even differentiate between the two techniques, simply saying "Shadow Clone Technique" regardless of how many clones he creates.
Whereas a small number of clones can be useful in a variety of ways, the huge number of clones created for this technique are almost exclusively used offensively, overwhelming opponents with countless attacks from all around.[3] Naruto also utilises the Multiple Shadow Clone Technique while creating the Wind Release: Rasengan, completing years' worth of training within a matter of days.[4]

While in the second state of their Sage Transformation, the user grows more of their jet booster-like appendages, extends them, and then uses them to gather natural energy before releasing it as a powerful chakra blast, covering a wide range. The rate at which the chakra is gathered and released is so fast that escaping the technique is impossible through normal means.

Influence
In Buddhism and other Asian religions, the lotus flower symbolises detachment, because although a lotus is living in water, its leafs do not get wet. In Jūgo's case, his second personality is detached from his normal self. The looks of this technique and the second part of its name make an allusion to acorn barnacles, called "fujitsubo" (フジツボ) in Japanese. The kanji 不自 literally mean "negative self", once again referring to Jūgo's second personality.

This technique is very similar in both execution and result to the Shuriken Shadow Clone Technique. It is a cooperation ninjutsu where three users, after throwing shuriken at their target and forming the necessary hand seals, can create corporeal replicas of the shuriken — turning a small amount of shuriken to a large amount in an instant with which to bombard the enemy. Unlike the Shuriken Shadow Clone Technique, however, this technique makes no use of the Shadow Clone Technique.

jutsu_type: Kekkei Genkai, Taijutsu, Ninjutsu, Space–Time Ninjutsu, Cooperation Ninjutsu
jutsu_description: Sakon and Ukon create some distance between themselves and their opponent with a kick. They split, and summon a Rashōmon behind their opponent, before merging and activating their cursed seal. They pummel their opponent with their fists against the Rashōmon until it breaks.

While occupying Sakon's body, Ukon adds his hands to Sakon's punches; when Sakon is about to punch something, both of Ukon's arms sprout from Sakon's arm. Ukon's punches can be performed simultaneously with Sakon's, increasing their combined power to the point of punching through rock, or Ukon can grab opponents to give Sakon's punch an easy target.[1]

Sakon and Ukon use their legs to spin with strong force to generate a whirlwind capable of deflecting any incoming attacks.

While occupying Sakon's body, Ukon adds his feet to Sakon's kicks; when Sakon is about to kick something, both of Ukon's legs sprout from Sakon's leg. Ukon's kicks can be performed simultaneously with Sakon's, increasing their combined power to the point of sending targets flying, or they can be performed in intervals, spacing out the damage to their target.[1]

This is the trademark ability of the Akimichi clan. When performed, the Akimichi grows in size, proportionately increasing their weight and strength and thus making their physical attacks more powerful.[1] Clothes they're wearing will change in size to accomodate them, as will certain weaponry, such as the bo.[2] Such a significant change in size places a great burden on the user's body.[1] In keeping with this, users typically are not seen maintaining the Multi-Size Technique for long periods of time, instead reverting back to their normal form after they've concluded their series of attacks.[3] During the Fourth Shinobi World War, Chōza and Chōji Akimichi at one point seem to use the Multi-Size Technique for several hours.[4]
There are two ways the Multi-Size has been depicted in the series. The first is where the user becomes extremely round, with most of the body's expansion being applied to their torso; because this is what happens to Chōchō Akimichi when she uses it, she dislikes performing it.[5] The second is where the user simply becomes larger, bigger than their normal size but not so big as when they use the Super Multi-Size Technique.[6] In the manga, Chōji uses the first during Part I and the second during Part II and onwards, suggesting the user's age or experience has something to do with it. Episodes of the anime set during Part II occasionally show Chōji using the first version, instead suggesting the two versions are interchangeable.[7][8]

This technique has exactly the same effect as Infinite Embrace, but this version is much larger and stronger as it could completely subdue and incapacitate Naruto Uzumaki, despite him using the Nine-Tails' chakra. The Magaki Group puts their opponent in a barrier that pushes down on them, preventing them from escaping and draining their chakra. The more effort place into the technique enhances its ability to subdue and drain chakra from the target.

By putting both hands on the ground, the user turns it into mud that erupts like a wall and swoops down on the enemy in a wave of muddy water. The mud clings to the target's body and, as it hardens, slows their movements.

After performing a long sequence of hand seals, the user converts much of a mountainside into mud, creating a landslide that crushes everything in its path. Ameyuki used this technique to destroy Shangri-la.

The user creates one or more humanoid shapes out of mud that carry out their bidding. Like sand clones, the mud dolls can recover from most damage they receive. When a mud doll captures an opponent, it can force its hand down their throat, drowning them with mud.

The user turns the ground beneath their target into a deep, muddy pit that the target will slowly sink into. To prevent targets from escaping, the walls of the pit are lined with hands made out of mud that pull the target deeper. These pits can only be created on earthen surfaces, so if a target is able to find something to stand on that is not made from dirt, they are safe from this technique.

See Also
Earth Release: Swamp of the Underworld
The user fires mud straight from their mouth at an enemy; the chakra-enhanced mud is able to trap and slow an opponent down.

The Morning Peacock is a certain-kill taijutsu born from the philosophy of Might Guy. The principle of this taijutsu is to rapidly increase the body's abilities by opening up to and including the sixth of the Eight Gates, and then to strike the enemy down with countless punches.

1 Usage
